text: [Music]
welcome to what's new with aws
i'm jeff barr i've got some great
launches to share with you today
first up let me tell you about an
important update to the ebs direct api
this api is designed for developers of
backup restore disaster recovery
and data management products and
services as a quick review
ebs lets you create block storage
volumes and you have many storage
options
the ebs snapshots in turn are copies of
the data from an ebs volume
the first one you make is full and the
rest one are change blocks only but all
that's managed internally for you
so we launched the ebs direct api last
december giving you support for
retrieving 512 kilobyte blocks of data
from your ebs snapshots
this means functions to list your
snapshot blocks get a snapshot block
and to list the blocks that have changed
between two snapshots
so what's new as my colleague sebastian
explains this blog post
you can now use the api to create
snapshots you could do this to move
on-premises block storage to cloud as
one example
and it takes the form of three new
functions start snapshot
put snapshot block and complete snapshot
once you're done you can use this
snapshot as you would any other ebs
snapshot
to learn more and to see this api in
action you can read sebastian's blog
post
okay so now that i'm working from home
i'm spending some time learning about
live streaming and this launch is really
timely and relevant
the new amazon interactive video service
lets you add live video to your apps and
websites
you simply create a channel and use any
streaming software to stream video to it
you use the associated player sdk to
build some apps and you're ready to go
once you start streaming video will show
up on your viewers screens with very low
latency
often the range of two to three seconds
you can also send time metadata
alongside the video stream
and use this to fire events in your
application at the right time you can
show product information
display a poll or put up a buy button
this service is super easy to use
to help you get started there's a live
stream preview in the console and
there's also a nice sample on codepen
when you check out that sample you'll
see that in less than 100 lines of
javascript you can create a player
display quizzes in response to those
timed events you can use this as a
starting point for your very own code
to learn a whole lot more you can read
martin's blog post
and finally we launched a preview of cdk
pipelines
the cdk as you might know is the cloud
development kit
lets you model your cloud application
resources using familiar programming
languages
all from within your favorite ide your
code can reference high level components
and it can include loops conditions and
so forth
when your code runs it generates a cloud
formation template that provisions those
resources
taken together this lets you use your
existing skills tools and source code
control to the task of building cloud
infrastructure
so the new cdk pipelines preview gives
you even more power
it lets you define simple or complex
code delivery pipelines
you can define the desired pipeline and
then share it across teams
and projects to enhance sharing you can
put each stage in a separate file
the pipelines you define have the power
to update themselves in place
this means you can add new deployment
stages to the pipeline or
you can add assets to your application
and the pipeline will automatically
update itself
to learn more check out the blog post
and you can even see the cdk pipelines
in action
alright that's what we've got for you
this time around we love your feedback
always look forward to it you can send
us some email tweet at me
leave a comment on the video i'd love it
if you subscribe to the channel
click the bell for notifications thank
you so much for watching and we shall
see you again soon
